sections.heading: FROM MALDIVES FAMILY COURT:
sections.quote: The biggest and most common cause of divorce we see is lack of communication. People not having conversations that need to be had. Many discussions should have been had BEFORE marriage.

sections.heading: THE PROBLEM:
items: Not discussing important topics before marriage
'When you're in love, talking about these things isn't appropriate'

sections.heading: THE REALITY:
items: 'We'll figure it out' becomes 'Why didn't we discuss this?!'
Couples who discuss everything before marriage have stronger, happier marriages

slides.title: "YOU" STATEMENTS vs "I" STATEMENTS
slides.formula: I feel [emotion] when [situation] because [reason]. I need [request].

slides.title: WHEN EMOTIONS GET TOO HIGH
slides.warningSignsHeading: Warning Signs You Need a Break:

technique.text: Set time to return ('Let's talk in 1 hour')

intro.question: What is Empathy?
intro.answer: 'Understanding how your partner feels, even if you don't agree'

example.title: Example: Money
scenarios: One partner saves every rufiyaa (grew up poor)
Other spends freely (never worried about money)
example.conclusion: Both are valid based on their experience!

slides.title: PRACTICE: CONVERT TO "I" STATEMENTS
slides.subtitle: Transform these 'You' statements:

exercises.template: I feel _______ when I'm talking and you're on your phone because _______. I need _______.
I feel _______ when we have plans and I wait because _______. I need _______.

slides.helpText: Feelings words to help: worried, hurt, frustrated, lonely, overwhelmed, scared, disappointed, unimportant

slides.title: PRACTICE SCENARIO: THE PHONE ISSUE
slides.scenario: Partner A feels hurt because Partner B is always on their phone during dinner.

sections.heading: BAD RESPONSE:
sections.content: 'You never pay attention to me! You care more about your phone than me!'

sections.heading: GOOD RESPONSE (I Statement):
sections.content: 'I feel lonely when we're at dinner and you're on your phone, because I want us to connect. I need us to have phone-free dinners together.'

sections.heading: ACTIVE LISTENING RESPONSE:
sections.content: 'I hear that you feel lonely at dinner when I'm on my phone. You're right - this is our time together. Let's both put phones away during meals.'

sections.heading: THE MISTAKE:
sections.content: Assuming you both want the same things without actually discussing them.

sections.heading: WHAT HAPPENS:
items: Partner A assumes they'll have 5 children

sections.heading: THE SOLUTION:
sections.content: DISCUSS EVERYTHING NOW. Even if it feels awkward.

slides.title: NOW: THE 15 ESSENTIAL DISCUSSIONS
slides.intro: From Maldives Family Court and focus groups with married/divorced couples, these are the topics that MUST be discussed before marriage.

slides.title: THE 15 ESSENTIAL TOPICS
slides.intro: These are the conversations that matter:
topics: 1. Children - Do we want them? When? How many?
2. Financial Management - How will we handle money?
3. Living Location - Where will we live?
6. Family Boundaries - How involved will families be?
7. Decision-Making - How do we decide things together?
8. Household Responsibilities - Who does what at home?
9. Religious Practices - What are our expectations?
10. Health Disclosure - Any conditions to share?
11. Conflict Resolution - How will we handle fights?
12. Future Contingencies - What if situations change?
13. Life Goals - What do we want to achieve?
15. Communication Agreement - Our ongoing communication plan

slides.title: DECISION 1A: DO WE WANT CHILDREN?
slides.subtitle: This is a fundamental decision. Discuss honestly.
slides.question: Both partners select (must match):
options: Unsure, need more time to decide
No, prefer not to have children
Need to discuss this with Ghaazee

slides.title: DECISION 1B: HOW MANY CHILDREN?
slides.subtitle: Only if you want children
slides.question: How many children:
options: As many as Allah gives us

slides.title: DECISION 1C: WHEN TO START?
slides.question: When to start trying for children:

slides.title: DECISION 1D: IF WE FACE INFERTILITY
slides.subtitle: 1 in 6 couples face infertility. Discussing this now prevents crisis later.
slides.question: If we try for a year and cannot conceive:
options: Need to discuss if it happens

slides.title: DECISION 2A: FINANCIAL SYSTEM
slides.subtitle: Money is a top cause of conflict. Decide your system NOW.
slides.question: How will we manage money?
options: Completely joint (all money in one account)
We manage together with equal input

slides.title: DECISION 2B: WHO PAYS FOR HOUSING?
slides.question: For housing (rent, utilities), who is responsible?

slides.title: DECISION 2C: BIG PURCHASES & DEBT
slides.question: Can either partner take loans without discussing first?

slides.title: DECISION 2D: FINANCIAL GOALS
slides.subtitle: What are your shared financial goals?
slides.question: We agree our top priority is:

slides.title: DECISION 3A: WHERE WILL WE LIVE?
slides.subtitle: Location affects everything: jobs, family, lifestyle, costs.
slides.question: Where will we live?

slides.title: DECISION 3B: TYPE OF HOUSING
slides.question: What type of housing?

slides.title: DECISION 4A: WILL BOTH PARTNERS WORK?
slides.subtitle: Wife has Islamic and legal right to work. This should be mutual decision.
slides.question: Work arrangements:
options: Will decide based on children's needs

slides.title: DECISION 4B: WORK-LIFE BALANCE
slides.subtitle: If both working, how will we balance work and home life?
slides.question: Our approach:
options: Whoever has more time does more
Need to discuss and assign tasks

slides.title: DECISION 5A: FAMILY INVOLVEMENT
slides.subtitle: Different expectations about family involvement cause major conflicts.
slides.question: After marriage, how involved should our families be?
options: Families can visit and advise freely
We decide independently, inform families after
Each handles their own family's issues
slides.demoCorrectAnswer: Each handles their own family's issues
slides.textMatchPrompt: Please both copy-paste your agreed statement:
slides.correctTextMatch: We agree that each partner will handle issues with their own family first, and only involve the spouse when necessary for support.

slides.title: DECISION 5B: SUPPORTING ELDERLY PARENTS
slides.question: If our parents need care when they're elderly:

slides.title: DECISION 6: HOW WE MAKE DECISIONS
slides.subtitle: Who decides what? This prevents future arguments.
slides.question: For MAJOR decisions (where to live, having children, big purchases):
options: Husband makes final decision after consultation
Each decides in their area of expertise

slides.title: DECISION 7: DIVISION OF HOUSEWORK
slides.question: How will we divide household chores?
options: Whoever has more time does more
Need to discuss and assign tasks

slides.title: DECISION 8: ISLAMIC PRACTICE EXPECTATIONS
slides.subtitle: What are our expectations about Islamic practices?
slides.question: We agree on approach to:

slides.title: DECISION 9: HEALTH SCREENING AGREEMENT
slides.subtitle: This protects both of you and future children.
slides.question: We agree to get pre-marriage health screening:
options: Yes, both of us will get tested
Yes, including STI and thalassemia testing
slides.demoCorrectAnswer: Yes, including STI and thalassemia testing

slides.title: DECISION 10: HOW WE'LL HANDLE CONFLICTS
slides.subtitle: When we have serious disagreements:
slides.question: We will:
options: Use PAUSE technique if too heated
Take breaks but always return to discuss
Seek counseling if we can't resolve
Never threaten divorce unless we mean it

slides.title: DECISION 11: IF SERIOUS ILLNESS OR DISABILITY
slides.question: If one of us becomes seriously ill or disabled:
options: We stay together and support each other
This is what marriage commitment means
We'll adjust our lives as needed

slides.title: DECISION 12: DAY-TO-DAY LIVING
slides.subtitle: Practical agreements about daily life
slides.question: We agree to:
options: Make time for each other weekly
Respect each other's need for alone time

slides.title: DECISION 13: OUR COMMUNICATION PLAN
slides.subtitle: Final commitment to ongoing communication
slides.question: We agree to communicate about:
options: Any problems early, not let them build
